results.title: Connecting Towns: A South Gippsland Cluster
results.brief_description: Take a tour through four small picturesque towns in South Gippsland that are combining their resources to create opportunities for growth. Here we meet some locals from Bena, Loch, Poowong and Nyora, in their places of significance as they reflect on personal memories and describe the uniqueness of where they live.

results.title: Artists of Mt Best
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, Dean Lawry and ACMI
results.brief_description: Mt Best is full of artists who have been inspired by the beauty, changing light and drama of this region in the Strezlecki Ranges. In this film we meet painters, photographers and musicians who talk about what drew them to the area, how the weather informs their work and how the community inspire each other.
results.description: Mt Best is full of artists who have been inspired by the beauty, changing light and drama of this region in the Strezlecki Ranges. results.title: Alternative Lifestyles
results.brief_description: From bubble-wrap insulation to a Buddhist stupa, experience alternative living in Mt Best. Meet Dr Chalko and his environmentally sustainable house and see how he converted a freezer into a fridge that uses less power per hour than a light bulb uses per day. Michael and Mary moved to Mt Best to find peace and to live in harmony with their surrounds, in the process they built a Stupa and a labyrinth in their backyard and invite anyone who wishes to come and contemplate a moment of their time.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Lockington
results.brief_description: Interviews with residents, groups and business owners of Lockington, Shire of Campaspe. These five short documentaries look at life in Lockington from different perspectives, covering local businesses, the Lockington Living Heritage Complex, a young girl growing up in Lockington, the experiences of a group of women and the Lockington Hotel, where the locals come to meet and enjoy local music at night.

Living in Locky: The Youth Perspective

results.title: Lockington Living Heritage Complex
results.brief_description: Celebrating and preserving the rich history of Lockington and its surrounding district, the dedicated and hard working volunteers of the Lockington Living Heritage Complex take us on a tour of the complex with the highlight being ‘The Big Shed’ which at 106 metres houses a restored Melbourne tram and the first ever pop top caravan, hand built in Lockington.

Living in Locky: The Youth Perspective

results.title: Living in Locky: The Youth Perspective
results.brief_description: 17 year old Locky local, Emma McInnes interviews a cross section of young people to find out what life in a rural town is really like. What is there to do? What the future holds and the all important question, are there many lookers in Locky?

results.title: Ladies of Lockington
results.brief_description: Meet the ladies who are at the heart of Lockington. These passionate and committed women get things done. They network, coordinate, manage and harness the talent that is available to them to improve and enhance the quality of life for all the families of Lockington and surrounding districts.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Campaspe
results.brief_description: Nine stories about residents from around the Campaspe region in northern Victoria. Covering the towns of Nanneella, Gunbower and Colbinabbin, locals tell stories about their lives and their connection to the land and the community.
results.title_for_label: ACMI in the regions: Stories from Campaspe

images.caption: Who gives a stuff about the farmer

group_works.title: Who Gives a Stuff About the Farmer

results.title: Who Gives a Stuff About the Farmer
results.brief_description: This provocative short documentary combines a song written by JR Williams about the plight of the dairy farmer with images of farmers at work in the Gunbower region. JR was inspired to write this song in response to the pipeline development that is set to take water from the Campaspe area to Melbourne. The song is to inform people, especially those living in the city that farmers are doing it tough and that taking water away from regional towns is not a sustainable solution for the city’s water shortage.
